output_list.criticism: The mintToken function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value, which also destroys the user's assets.
The freezeAccount function allows the owner to freeze an arbitrary user's account, which gives the owner control over the user's assets.
The setPrices function is public and allows the owner to set the prices used for buying and selling the tokens, which gives the owner control over the pricing of the tokens.
The enablePurchasing function allows the owner to enable purchasing, which gives the owner control over whether or not users can buy the tokens.
The disablePurchasing function allows the owner to disable purchasing, which gives the owner control over whether or not users can buy the tokens.
The burnFrom function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to zero, which also destroys the user's assets.
The burn function has an integer overflow that allows the owner to set the balance of an arbitrary user to zero, which also destroys the user's assets.
The sell function allows the owner to sell an arbitrary user's assets, which gives the owner control over the user's assets.
